data.title: UAE suspends multi-billion dollar weapons deal in sign of growing frustration with US-China showdown
data.description: The United Arab Emirates has suspended a multi-billion dollar deal to buy US-made F-35 fighter jets, in a sign of Abu Dhabi's growing frustration with Washington's attempts to limit Chinese technology sales to the oil-rich Gulf state.

data.title: Climate activists criticize BlackRock CEO's support for slow transition off oil and natural gas
data.description: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says oil and gas companies are going to be an important part of the bridge to a decarbonized future. Climate leaders reject this idea.

data.title: U.S. companies are expecting to pay an average 3.4% raise to workers in 2022
data.description: Companies are increasing their budgets for pay raises as labor challenges continue, according to a new survey.

data.title: Larry Fink says the next 1,000 unicorns will be green energy companies
data.description: In his carefully watched annual letter, BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the potential for start-ups and investors in climate technology is unprecedented.

data.title: Microsoft's $68.7 billion deal for Activision once again shows big tech's dominance over legacy media
data.description: Microsoft takes big $68.7 billion swing on video game company Activision Blizzard while legacy media stays on sidelines

data.title: 4 signs a company is actually invested in remote work long-term
data.description: Allowing people to work from home isn't the same thing as making the remote-work experience a good one.

data.title: Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard in $68.7 billion deal
data.description: Microsoft announced plans to acquire Activision Blizzard, the video game company behind blockbuster hits like "Warcraft," "Overwatch" and "Call of Duty," in an all-cash transaction valued at $68.7 billion. Microsoft says that the move will make the company the third-largest gaming company by revenue, after Tencent and Sony.

data.title: War vet creates company to help other veterans
data.description: War vet creates company to help other veterans

data.title: Want to keep your workers? Change your climate policies
data.description: Climate change policies have become front and center for companies — not only because of ethics and reputation, but also because their employees demand it.

data.title: Peloton is hiking prices because of inflation
data.description: Peloton says inflation and supply chain challenges have forced the company to hike the price of its flagship bike, just five months after cutting it drastically to boost sagging sales.
